aws::graph::propositions: # Helicopter Maintenance and Weather Conditions Report
His mission was to maintain the helicopters and assist with helicopter movement.
He assisted with the movement of N96BM outside of the hangar to pad 1.
He had not realized that N96BM had been placed outside of the pad 1 landing box.
He realized N96BM was outside the pad 1 landing box after he disconnected the auxiliary power unit (APU).
He started back to the hangar after disconnecting the auxiliary power unit (APU).
He had been inside the hangar for about a minute when he heard a loud explosion.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport (BUR) in Burbank, California at 1628 indicated visibility as 3 statute miles.
Bob Hope Airport is located 8 miles west of the accident site.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1628 included light rain showers.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1628 included wind from 180-degrees at 6 knots.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1628 included scattered clouds at 1,100 feet.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1628 included broken clouds at 1,600 feet.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1628 included overcast clouds at 3,100 feet.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1553 reported visibility as 5 statute miles.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1553 included rain showers.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1553 included wind from 210-degrees at 6 knots.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1553 included scattered clouds at 1,100 feet.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1553 included broken clouds at 1,900 feet.
Weather at Bob Hope Airport at 1553 included overcast clouds at 2,600 feet.
N96BM is a helicopter.

text:
his mission was to maintain the helicopters, and assist with helicopter movement
* He recalled that he assisted with the movement of N96BM outside of the hangar to pad 1
* He had not realized that N96BM had been placed outside of the pad 1 landing box until after he disconnected the auxiliary power unit (APU) and had started back to the hangar
* He stated that he had been inside the hangar for about a minute when he heard a loud explosion

## Meteorological Information
* Weather obtained at 1628 for the Bob Hope Airport (BUR), Burbank, California, 8 miles west of the accident site, indicated visibility as 3 statute miles, light rain showers, wind from 180-degrees at 6 knots, cloud conditions scattered at 1,100 feet, broken at 1,600 feet, and overcast at 3,100 feet
* At 1553, BUR reported weather conditions as visibility 5 statute miles, rain showers, wind from 210-degrees at 6 knots, cloud conditions as scattered at 1,100 feet, broken at 1,900 feet, and overcast 2,600 feet
